body: Just discovered that it happens even if you open source settings and just hit 'Cancel' with no change. It will produce black. However, hitting 'Ok' is fine. Weird stuff :P
thanks for the report, gonna check this
i was able to confirm. Thanks

i am suspecting an sdk underlying issue where reloading of the FX gets stuck. Not sure it can be fixed on our side. I'll discuss this with our nvidia contacts. There's no such issue with greenscreen effect which makes me suspect the blur sdk since the code seems ok.

Thanks for looking into it. 

Quick one: is 0.05 the lowest amount of blur one could have? The blur at 0.05 is too much for my use case. I just want a really subtle blur

> Thanks for looking into it. 
> 
> Quick one: is 0.05 the lowest amount of blur one could have? The blur at 0.05 is too much for my use case. I just want a really subtle blur

I've set it at 0.05 steps indeed. I could lower it to 0.01.  I'll do some tests first.

@nacalai the bug is gone for me; can you confirm with current version of obs and last nvidia drivers but don't upgrade nvidia audio fx binaries (a new version is available but it doesn't work yet with current obs)

@pkviet Hey! Still happens for me sadly.. 
- OBS 31.0.1 
- Nvidia Studio Drivers 572.16.
- Audio Effects 1.3.0.21
- Video Effects 0.7.2
- I did have latest Nvidia Broadcast installed. Tried removing it. No effect.

> @pkviet Hey! Still happens for me sadly..

> - Audio Effects 1.3.0.21
> - Video Effects 0.7.2

Could you try the following:
- retrieve recent builds of obs on github (artefacts), for instance those from my nvidia filters PR from yesterday. 
- update to the latest drivers, as well as sdk redistributables (0.7.6 and 1.6.0)

issue.title: nv-filters: Various improvements

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 32.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion in OBS Studio 32.0.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description
The PR consists in various improvements available with latest NVIDIA Effects SDK
(as of February 2025, Video FX = 0.7.6 ; Audio FX = 1.6.0):
- use new NVIDIA logger function for audio and video SDK (useful for debugging purposes);
- instead of destroying audio effects when the SDK returns an error, disable it. This avoids calling the destroy source function from within the filter and will avoid some crashes;
- for audio effects, a new VAD (Voice Audio Data) toggle is added, which optimizes the filters processing for voice (removing low-volume noise and all non-speech data);
- for Background Removal filter, SDK >= 0.7.6 introduces new methods whereby chairs can be removed or not, along with the said background.
Additionally, a fix is added when resetting background removal effect; the temporal state variable was not properly re-initialized when resetting the effect.

**Edit (2/28/25):**
- fix added for the third-party bug [1]; the nvidia sdk does not ensure that alpha is set to 1 for the foreground in Background removal. We bypass this by enforcing an alpha value to 1 above a given threshold in the filter. 
There's an edge case however when the threshold is set to 1.0 where the bulk foreground is not set to 1, while one would expect a well defined bulk at alpha = 1.
The fix added deals with this edge case by setting a max threshold to 0.95.

[1] https://github.com/FiniteSingularity/obs-stroke-glow-shadow/issues/61

**Edit (3/10/2025)**
- fix added for bug #11383 where blur effect led to blank source whenever the parent source was updated.

**Edit (3/12/2025)**
All the bugfixes have been split into their own PR:
https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/pull/11952

### Motivation and Context
Improve the current effects by adding new options available with newer SDK.
New audio option:
![obs64_2025-02-26_00-09-20](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eee616df-9a1d-4432-bfd3-4d0ba35af52c)

New video options:
![obs64_2025-02-26_00-10-39](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9905f19b-d9b6-49a4-a68e-e5e562b99188)

### How Has This Been Tested?
The effects all work fine. Tested on win 11 with an RTX 4090.

### Types of changes
- New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- Tweak (non-breaking change to improve existing functionality) 

### Checklist:
- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.
